did.unittitle: Streamwood, Ill. Pilgrim Congregational Church records, 1959-1966.
did.abstract: The Pilgrim Congregational Church in Streamwood, Illinois, was formally gathered in 1959. Rev. Philip Hubard Ward was the organizing minister. The church was a member of the United Church of Christ. It likely dissolved around 1971 or 1972. This collection contains a single volume of church records that includes vital membership information and meeting minutes.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The materials in this collection were given to the Illinois Conference of the United Church of Christ, likely around the time of the church's dissolution. There is no further documentation on how the materials arrived at the Illinois Conference.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Pilgrim Congregational Church in Streamwood, Illinois, was formally gathered in 1959, though its people had been worshipping together since at least 1958. The church, in its initial form, may have been known as the Community Church. Rev. Philip Hubard Ward was the organizing minister. Through Ward, the church had a connection with the First Congregational Church in Elgin, Illinois. The church was a member of the United Church of Christ. It likely dissolved around 1971 or 1972.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a single volume containing church records. The register includes membership information, lists of baptisms, marriages, and deaths. The register also includes meeting minutes, including minutes of annual meetings.
